website_summaries.verdict: A budget-priced mic that's not perfect, but it gets the job done.

customer_reviews.title: Using with headphones as a gaming "headset"
customer_reviews.text: Using this in addition to an Audiotechnica ATH-M50X as a gaming headset. It works very well and has a 3.5mm jack to plug your headphones in where you can hear yourself talk over the mic which is nice. It can also be used without headphones, people understand me fine in directional mode even when using loud PC speakers. There's a bit of feedback when a cell phone is near. Not sure if this is an issue with all mics, or just this one. Maybe since it's so small it isn't shielded as well as it could be if it were larger. Overall this thing as been great. Would buy again and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jaymee

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for a teacher.
customer_reviews.text: I am a math teacher and primarily use it to record examples or explanations of concepts that I post for my students to access at home or on their phones. The mic provides the ample volume and clarity I need and it is easily stowed away when not in use (little bit more difficult to do that with a Snow Ball). It's compact, convenient, and is a giant step up in audio quality from a $15 desktop microphone. Would definitely recommend for any teacher looking to post video/audio instructions or examples.
customer_reviews.author: QuiMarLoe

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible w/ Win 10.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work on Windows 10. Win 10 does not recognize the mic is plugged into the usb port. No drivers are available online. Left message a week ago about it not working before giving a review. No contact has been made by seller.
customer_reviews.author: Skayadog

customer_reviews.title: Be warned - Issue for IPAD or IPHONE video conferencing
customer_reviews.text: When you connect the microphone to the lightning port (using a separate USB adapter) the OS recognizes the device as a microphone AND a speaker. This means that all output will be sent to the Go mic.. In order to hear anything you have two choices: 1) you need to plug a speaker or headphones into the 3.5mm plug that is on the mic body. 2) use a separate bluetooth speaker/headphone and then in Settings on iOS 13.3.1 change Accessibility-Touch-Call Audio Routing to Bluetooth. For video conference purposes I just wanted a better microphone and get output from the ipad speaker so this is not the product for that.
customer_reviews.author: T. Voyageur

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Microphone
customer_reviews.text: This thing was crap, barely ever works, keeps freezing up on me, records super high background noises, will miss-record parts or words. While doing a screen recording tutorial video, it locks up and freezes the screen. 70 % of the time it doesn't even work. And it's not my PC, I have a super duty custom built 3D Cad design PC with 64GB ram, 16TB of Drive space and 12 core CPU, so I know it's not the PC. Don't waste your money. Buy a "Blue" brand microphone. Yeti model is best.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Dupuis

customer_reviews.title: Amazing while it worked
customer_reviews.text: This is really a great microphone. At least it was. Now, my computer sporadically doesn't recognize it. I can be solidly into a meeting when, all of a sudden, I hear the Windows error jingle letting me know the microphone has decided to act up again. This now happens consistently enough to render the microphone useless. And if you're thinking this may be a problem with my computer, it isn't. My Mac no longer recognizes the microphone at all. It's either both my laptop and PC have an issue or only the Go Mic does. Occam's Razor, ya know.
customer_reviews.author: Deelahn

customer_reviews.title: Cord is not as described.  Great Mic and stand.
customer_reviews.text: Im docking one star because it says that it comes with a 10 foot USB cord and the cord is probably 6 feet at most. In addition, there's no room to store the mic and USB cable in the case, only the mic will fit. The mic and stand are a great product. Worked fantastically with my my Macbook Pro for recording meetings. Looks professional and easy to install and use. I use mine with the free Audacity software. The red light on the front tells you if the gain is too high, so that really helps you set the recording level at the right place for what you are recording.
customer_reviews.author: Fredster

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, its garbage!
customer_reviews.text: This mic sucks! I do podcasts and it has screwed up two of my interviews already. The mics sensitivity increased dramatically no matter what setting i had it on... it became unusable. i like samson but this is junk... save your money... or buy something better
customer_reviews.author: Reinaldo Franqui

customer_reviews.title: Decent Voice Quality; Parasitic Digital Whine
customer_reviews.text: Voice quality is decent. Form factor is compact. Build quality is solid. Unless you hold this microphone within a few inches of your mouth you have to add gain. Once you add gain you will hear a whine at 1kHz, 2kHz, 3kHz, 4kHz, etc in the recording. It's really obvious in a quiet room. This is not standard white noise but digital noise most likely due to poor isolation of the ADC from the USB bus. It can be removed with a notch filter in Audacity but not without affecting the recording quality. Sadly, the Samson Meteor has the exact same issue.
customer_reviews.author: dimaxp

customer_reviews.title: Great portable mic
customer_reviews.text: I use this mic a ton for video conferencing. I had the Amazon Basics version (which is also good) but this Samson comes with additional bells and whistles. I like that I can plug headphones straight into the mic and can hear playback if I happen to be recording through the mic. I can also change the pickup pattern.
customer_reviews.author: ceej

customer_reviews.title: clip limitations, rather unnecessary for Apple devices
customer_reviews.text: I'd purchased this for use with my ipad, and found it difficult to keep it clipped on. It's easier to use the base as a stand, but that limits you to staying still and propping your ipad up on a table. And given the high quality mic built in to the ipad, unless you're recording a podcast, this mic just isn't needed. (And if you are recording something more important, purchase or fashion a wind screen/pop filter, regardless of the mic)
customer_reviews.author: Thor

customer_reviews.title: Came in a white box, with missing contents
customer_reviews.text: I bought it from Amazon (Sold by: Amazon.com Services LLC). It just arrived today... however this is not what would expect. It literally came in a white box, with the mic and a cable in it - nothing else. There is supposed to be, at least a nice padded carrying case. With contents missing and the look of the box, it raises doubt that if I received a new or used product, or if it is genuine. This type of stuff usually happens when you purchase from a third party vendor, but from Amazon.com, is something I did not expect.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Noise while recording. Not as good as built-in mic.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this mic after seeing good reviews, but after A/Bing it with my 2019 Macbook Pro's built-in microphone, I could barely hear a difference. To be fair, I think that says more about how far built-in mics have come, but I digress. In fact, the GoMic sounded worse because it emitted noise while recording. I tried different USB hubs and got the same noise both times. The form factor is great, and maybe I only heard noise on my particular unit, so your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good - but has a Mini USB port
customer_reviews.text: Just got the microphone. The picture is deceiving as the mic is very small, 1 ice wide and 2.5 inches tall. Good for traveling I guess. Tested it on a Zoom call and on a website that plays back a recording. I sound like I'm in an empty room but no echo. Pretty good. I've attached a video of the playback from the website. Check it out. It has a mini USB port of the side and a cable. Don't lose the cable as mini USB has more or less disappeared from use.
customer_reviews.author: L. Kwok

customer_reviews.title: awesome product. Must have for home office with kids.
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing to compare this to but I love it. The packaging and design is great for use with an arm, mini tripod, clipping on your laptop, or just standing on its own. The sound quality is excellent and the cardioid is perfect if you need the sound to focus on you and not the kids in the background.
customer_reviews.author: JR.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite portable microphone
customer_reviews.text: Great little portable microphone. I am a freelance court reporter and I clip this mic to my laptop screen cover for depositions. It’s small enough to not be intimidating to the witnesses, but powerful enough to pick up everyone in the room clearly, and it doesn’t get covered up by exhibits on the table. I like it so much I bought a second one as a backup. You can’t beat the price for the quality you get from this little mic.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Dugas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mic to record classes and podcast.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size. Great construction quality. I use this mic to record classes with Office Mix. The sound is clearly superior to the mic from the notebook. Has two modes, to record from all or just from the front. It connects through the USB port. Also, you can connect any headphones to listen to yourself during the recording. Great value for the price. Reccomended also for vlogging or podcast. I bought also a pop audio filter as the
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Uribe

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality, nice build.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, nicely engineered, feels substantial, super portable for road warriors. Gets high makes in online reviews for size/sound/$$$. I had some difficulty getting it to work on my laptop, played with settings for an hour. Sometimes new gear can be fussy to add on. Finally got it to work with all my programs. At first it worked with Skype and not video program. Finally found using external mic and internal speaker worked best. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: PolarPro

customer_reviews.title: The best little mic you can own.
customer_reviews.text: I will never not own one of these microphones. I have bought 2 of them. I liked the first one so much, I gave it to a friend and bought a second one. I use it whenever I need great portable audio without using the obnoxious mic in my computer. You legit cannot beat the quality of this mic for the price. It is the size of your thumb and conveniently clips anywhere. The only issue is that i would never clip it to a computer screen or table because it will pick up the audio very easily. Definitely needs a Noise Gate on it. Overall perfect for what it needs to do!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not a noticeable improvement over my apple's built-in mic in terms of sound quality, but adds some versatility.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little gadget. Set up instantly on my Macbook Pro running El Cap. I can't say it's a huge improvement over the built-in mic that came with the computer. I can't hear a difference in QuickTime voice recordings, anyway. But it does make it easier to use my laptop as a speaker phone, because you can set this mic to be omnidirectional. You can also easily get close to this mic if you want/need to, or you could place it by the sound hole of a guitar, etc. They give you a nice long USB cord. For the price, it's a nice little device. It's also incredibly cute.
customer_reviews.author: picky

customer_reviews.title: Linux friendly mic for zoom
customer_reviews.text: With the web cam shortage leading to rediculoisly high prices, this mic is a great alternative. On the plus side nobody now has to see what I look like (win/win). Just plugged into my modern Linux hardware running Ubuntu 19.10 and worked. Started zoom and it worked. I haven't used it yet, but I expect very good sound quality. My son has the larger meteor version and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: RedAnt

customer_reviews.title: Flexible Android recording with very good sound
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use for recording acoustic guitar into an Android tablet using Open Camera to bypass the native mic while recording video. It does a very nice job of this with of course placement options along with the cardiod vs Omni vs 10 db pad to get quite a good recorded sound.. Much improved sound over the native device mic. A lot of mic in a small convenient package. Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Warren K.

customer_reviews.title: it works well but I dont think its supposed to rattle
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality and sturdy metal clip design. what concerns me is the rattle noise inside the microphone piece. this is how it sounded OUT OF THE BOX which was disappointing. I think I may have gotten a defective one or it was rough-handled during the shipping process. Either way, it makes me question the quality of the materials used on the inside. It would be nice to get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Renn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little microphone for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Recording audio is excellent for podcasts! Audio quality is top notch for the price point! And the price was an absolute steal! There are mics that are 3x the price as this one and can’t even compete with the quality. Love the size as well! Soooo small and compact! It’s about the height of 1 1/2 of a those square crackers you get with peanut butter in them! Lol! Great product! Would definitely recommend for podcasters on the go!
customer_reviews.author: Nadia

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: A lot of great reviews, but this mic has extreme static and it’s horrible at blocking out background noise of any kind on all three settings. Even after editing and trying various settings it doesn’t produce good quality sound. I was primarily attempting to record narrative and it did not sound good at all. The mic on my MacBook Pro produced a better product than this mic. The majority of recordings pick up background noise such as the hum of a fridge, or AC, and have a loud static, to the point where is drowns out speech and causes a major distraction.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic as a main desktop microphone
customer_reviews.text: The crystal clear audio is worth it alone. The mode switch and headphone jack are great extras. I get asked often in Discord which microphone I use. Cable is short; probably because this microphone had laptops in mind. Standard mini USB port so easily replaceable. I highly recommend NoiseGator for real time voice enhancement for any microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Great little mic
customer_reviews.text: Great little mic. I used this in a small classroom about 20' away from the professor and was still able to pick up the audio quite well. Audio quality is clear even at that distance and not muddy at all. So far, this is the best mic for a classroom setting I've found. I use it in conjunction with an Asus VivoTab Note 8 which is like a mini Microsoft Surface. With this mic and my tablet, I can record lectures and write notes simultaneously in OneNote which is perfect for going over things when you're reviewing notes.
customer_reviews.author: George L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Mic for Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I got this Mic essentially for gaming. When on sale it’s the best mic for the price. This mic works great and there’s no complaint about the performance. I do wish the cable was a little longer and the clamp it comes with feels like it’s only big enough to clamp onto a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lime

customer_reviews.title: another great mic
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mic and another one but was not sure which would work better. They both work fantastic. and are both well built. This one does not have a volume control but does have a mute option. all control is done on the windows or mac side.but over all it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, high-quality product for a good price
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent, high-quality product for a good price. Marketing materials suggest using it with a laptop which was my purpose, however I find several issues with this: - Clasp is not thick enough to be convenient to put on top of my laptop screen. - Picks up noise coming through my laptop speakers all too well, even using cardioid mode with multiple positioning configurations. This makes it very poor for conferencing. - Laptop fan is picked up loud and clear, almost as well as my voice. That said, I have no doubt I'll use this fantastic microphone for other purposes -- it picks up sound fantastically with an excellent flat frequency response.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Batto

customer_reviews.title: Great Overall Value!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't purchase this product for anything of the professional production sort; instead, it was to overcome the limitations of using Google's Hangout Meet app in a boardroom setting. I've got a MacBook Pro and it just can't pick up all the voices of a meeting with its microphone. Using traditional call lines combined with the app created feedback issues; so, I needed another reasonable solution. For its price point I don't think there's a better product for similar consumer needs as mine.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Salisbury

customer_reviews.title: This is the most bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: The sensitivity of this mic is unmatchable. You could hear a pin drop on the other side of the room when recording with this. It’s clarity is amazing and it is SO portable. The only downside is that the case does not fit the cord with it, so it is very easy to mistakenly separate the two. Other than that? No complaints. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: small size, big sound
customer_reviews.text: I recorded 10 sample clips soon as I got it in an open environment on the -10 db and it was crystal clear... no hiss or static and it seemed to filter out the background noise. I do recommend editing software to go with this as you will need to add a bit of gain so the volume isn't too low but it still doesn't effect the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: James Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little Mic
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because of the rave reviews and also because of its size which is perfect for travelers like me. At first the sound echoed and I almost returned it but decided to call support. Amazon connected me to the manufacturer's support and they were able to help me and I was up and running within 2 minutes. Perfect product with great support. Thumbs way up!
customer_reviews.author: Niloo M Soleimani

customer_reviews.title: Not for Mac users
customer_reviews.text: 2 out of 2 bad out of the box. Not worth pursuing, at least for Mac users with El Capitan.... it records audio that is 2 or 3 octaves lower. swapped back and forth with onboard mic and Yeti Blue, as well as Plantronics voyager head set.... all worked fine. No go on the Go mic.
customer_reviews.author: DMW

customer_reviews.title: Good value mic
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is a fabulous mic. The only knock is it's very sensitive to popping P's and B's. But I bought the PEMOtech pop filter, also from Amazon, and that took care of things.
customer_reviews.author: H. K.

customer_reviews.title: Can't be beat for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Still challenges $100 usb Mics at a third the price. This is a GREAT first step for gamers looking to increase the quality of their voice chat. If you want something nicer than this, I'd jump directly into the XLR space. If they ever re-release this mic with a USB-C connector, I'll probably buy a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Bardo

customer_reviews.title: Great Compact Microphone for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mic after some deep online searching. I'm happy to say I was not disappointed. This little mic packs a really good sound into it. Sometimes it's almost too good as I once picked up my wife clicking away at a keyboard for work upstairs while I was downstairs. Overall it's been a big help recording meetings, quick voiceovers and webcasting. I've suggested this mic to friends who were looking for something simple, compact and solid several times. The only thing missing is a more soundproof room in my house!
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Buy this Mic
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good quality mic for Dragon Speaking voice recognition software and recording videos. I needed something on the smaller side since I have limited space. Even though I seen all the great reviews on this mic I was still skeptical because of the reasonable price and size of the mic. Well, I was pleasantly surprised. I am definitely impressed with the rich sound quality. It fits so nicely on my crowded desk. I love how it is portable - folds up and fits nicely in the black semi- hard zip up case that is included. In my opinion this mic is an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: jdiane

customer_reviews.title: A great mic for a low price
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play on my macbook. I got an emf meter and am no longer using headphones. Not when I saw the amount of radiation in my ear. It noise cancels other sounds in the room every big as well as the noise canceling headsets I have been using. Cable a bit short but...detaches so it can be replaced without buying a new mic which is bain of all webcams.
customer_reviews.author: Pro EFT Bill

customer_reviews.title: So cute
customer_reviews.text: So gorgeous, and compact, especially in its little carry case. Clipped onto my laptop beautifully and the top of my tablet. Unfortunately I couldn't get it to work with the devices that I have. I got an OTG adapter but still my 10 minutes couldn't communicate with it for recording purposes. Oh sorry it went right on my laptop, but it didn't seem to record any differently than the built-in mic. I returned it. I'm sure the problem was with my equipment not the beautiful microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Davies

customer_reviews.title: Big Mic in a Small Package
customer_reviews.text: The initial reaction was that this was really small. It seemed much smaller than it looked in the pictures. I've used it now and while I don't think it'll be mistaken for a professional microphone anytime soon, it does record nicely. It seems like a really good, portable solution for recording audio.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Ede

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for small and cheap, it's great... buuuut
customer_reviews.text: This is just a pet peeve of mine, so if this doesn't bother you, I'd say go for it. But the amount of audio delay between sound going into the microphone and then coming back through the headphone jack is about .2-.5 seconds, which is enough to give me a headache. I only had to purchase this for a class, so it isn't that bad, but if you want to do dialogue recording and listen to yourself while recording, DO NOT get this mic.
customer_reviews.author: Bramnet

customer_reviews.title: The sound is amazing for the size and price
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews. But, I have to commend Samson for delivering such a high quality product in such a small form. It's the size of two matchbooks and it's weight is dense from heavy metal material. The sound is amazing for the size and price. Perfect if you're on the go or in need of a high quality mic for people on human salaries. There's 3 modes for quick sound adjustments depending on your environment. The cardioid modes will help with noisy background noise. I love how small it is and the quality of build. Bravo, Samson.
customer_reviews.author: dhan1

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Mic in small package.
customer_reviews.text: I gave the Mic a try and great to use with gaming , video conferencing, and recording podcast. Compact and great to lose with desktop or laptop pc.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Slone

customer_reviews.title: I can never recommend this enough
customer_reviews.text: I can never recommend this enough! For $40 it easily competes with most any USB microphone under $100, including popular choices like the Razer Seiren, Blue Snowball or Samson Meteorite. For a budget microphone it performs fantastically, and I generally wouldn't really recommend anything more than this unless you were getting into something like recording music or podcasting - in which case I'd start recommending microphones starting around $150. For everyone else, this microphone is by far the best bang for your buck. But as with anyone looking to buy a microphone: Don't just take my word for it. Go listen to demos and reviews posted on YouTube using this exact microphone to know what you're getting yourself into.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Podcasting on the Run with One of the Best Portable Mics Available
customer_reviews.text: So I left my ATS 2005 mic at another location and needed to get an additional mic. I shopped the reviews and found this one to be well received. The performance is on par with my studio mic for podcasting and I have already used this on the road with spectacular results. The size is incredible for the performance delivered. It is quite literally the size of a credit card and about an inch tall less the USB cable which it comes with. So I've put together a small studio kit from a small Maxpedition organizer that I can throw in my luggage. The only thing I need to figure out is how to configure a pop filter.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Buppert

customer_reviews.title: Insanity
customer_reviews.text: This little mix has almost the same quality of my condenser mic at home. I’m pretty mad at myself that I haven’t gotten one of these sooner. Get this if you need portability. No regrets!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Excellent microphone and second time I am buying in 5 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product about 5 years ago and again now. I use dragon medical for dictation and my powermic III sucks. This is portable to put on my laptop and wheel from room to room to dictate. Accuracy for the dictation improved dramatically. My old Samsung mic still works, I just dropped it and the microphone detached from the clip. The new one works well.
customer_reviews.author: jobra

customer_reviews.title: ... use this for a weekly podcast and it works great! There are a couple settings on it and ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this for a weekly podcast and it works great! There are a couple settings on it and at least one of them is actually too much power for what I am doing! I might try it for some rough vocal tracks on a song or two some time. It sounds good enough on my show to warrant at least an attempt. Highly recommended. Fits in the palm of your hand. If anything, it's too powerful. I sit it on my desk and if I stir my drink with my finger, it picks up the ice clinking against the glass like a bell ringing. But if I bothered to suspend it or clip it somewhere, problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Crisler

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for the first few month's I had it and ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for the first few month's I had it and then promptly stopped work right as the warranty ran out. Luckily, I had already upgraded to a better Sony product. If you're going to use it to do any kind of podcasting, you're better off investing $20-$30 more and getting a decent digital recorder with a lapel mic. The sounds is fine while it works, but you do have to be rather close to it for it to pick up audio clearly. It won't work if you mount it to the top of your screen or place it in the center of a table to record a conversation.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: the middle is for when you're very close (and does a great job getting rid of background noise)
customer_reviews.text: I am thoroughly impressed with this microphone. I have been using it to record narration for youtube videos. Yes it is a "hot mic", but there are three settings on the side that allow you to adjust it to your audio needs. The bottom-most setting is the hottest, the middle is for when you're very close (and does a great job getting rid of background noise), the top-most is a blend between the two. When used in combination with the headphone output jack and a quality pair of studio headphones, anyone should be able to quickly determine which setting is right for their environment. I also own the Samson Meteor, but this little puppy does a much better job.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Evo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pocket mic and a crying shame they did away ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pocket mic and a crying shame they did away with this model. I use it for work as a work-from-home call center rep, and this is able to run 40+ hours a week with no sweat. Captures sound really well for both cardioid and omnidirectional and very clean, and perfectly suitable for music or ambience recording or if you just want your voice to come through in high quality. Only downside is USB-only, but does double as a headphone jack that works great.
customer_reviews.author: Liv4Hymn

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine With PC or MAC - But Not Android
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this trying to find an external mic solution for Android video recording in noisy environments. Unfortunately, I couldn't get my Galaxy S10 to pull audio from it in video recordings, even with an app that recognized the mic. (FilMic Pro) Beautiful construction, just not for what I needed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Stafford

customer_reviews.title: Not in original box
customer_reviews.text: Got mine in a white box. Watched a few videos of unboxing and this is definitely not the original box. No plastic on the mic and i can tell the string that holds the mini cable was unwind. Totally USED item. Now having doubts that it's not only used but also fake. Will return
customer_reviews.author: quitosky

customer_reviews.title: Seems to have very good sound quality, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: We couldn't get our mic on the Microsoft Surface Pro to work, so we bought this, plugged it in, adjusted the mic settings in our anti-virus/firewall program (allowed Zoom to use the mic) and it worked great. The small size would be fine if we needed it for travel. Seems to be robustly built
customer_reviews.author: Tim G

customer_reviews.title: loved it-update
customer_reviews.text: until it stopped working a year in. Not sure why. But customer service responded quickly and will replace it for me Update: customer service excellent. I reported the broken mic. Returned it and within two weeks had another delivered to my door. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: charis

customer_reviews.title: Lasts long, works well
customer_reviews.text: I've used this mic for taking audionotes during undergrad lectures, recording instruments for YouTube videos, and conference calling for interviews. It has worked reliably and the three settings make picking up nuanced sound fanstastic. When using the close-up setting, I suggest a sound muffler like a sock to avoid percussive "p" sounds when you speak.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Hebert

customer_reviews.title: Not for note taking and lecture recording
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this hooked up to my laptop to record lectures. I also type notes on this laptop so all my recordings are filled with loud clip clap of typing. It's not the proximity to the keyboard either because it doesn't change if I move it
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: I've had mics in the past that cost over 200 bucks that haven't sounded as good as this one
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this mic to make YouTube Videos and demo recordings with garage band on my mac for a few years now. I've had mics in the past that cost over 200 bucks that haven't sounded as good as this one. For the price, you cannot beat it and the greatest part is it fits nicely in a pocket or in a laptop case as it's smaller than the palm of your hand. Mine never leaves my laptop case, so if I get inspired to make a video or record a song - it's always with me.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great quality microphone
customer_reviews.text: This microphone is REALLY strong. Much stronger than you think. Picks up everything and anything. That may be a good thing but also could be a bad thing. Up to you how you play with the sensitivity but the value is very good. Really good microphone to a fault potentially!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good for songwriters
customer_reviews.text: Great little mic for getting down and fleshing out song ideas on the go, especially when paired with a good multitrack recording app if using with your phone /mobile device. Just make sure to get the proper USB adapter for your phone. I had to get a USB to USB-c adapter. They're very on amazon here. Only downside to this is the fact there's no volume control. You have to be judicious in how/where you place the mic, but even then everything gets recorded "hot".
customer_reviews.author: J. T.

customer_reviews.title: What a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The only way this mic pics up your voice at all is if you're holding it directly in front of your mouth, and even then your recording comes out sounding muffled and full of static. Sending it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Mayfield-Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I came from having a REALLY crappy microphone to having this, so I'm nothing short of blown away. It's very clear and powerful and packs a lot of features. It has 3 modes- single direction, omnidirectional, and sort of a lowered volume version of the single direction mode. Lastly, its form factor is great. I can leave it on my desk and just speak into it casually if I'm gaming or just clip it onto my shirt like a lapel mic and go about it that way. For the money, you can't possibly do better.
customer_reviews.author: C M

customer_reviews.title: Very good laptop/desktop microphone
customer_reviews.text: Bought to pair with desktop Windows 10 pc. Very good microphone. I am able to speak commands to Cortana features and 'Ok Google' in Chrome. It functions much better than the built-in mic of my Logitech webcam. I recommend purchasing the Samson Sound Deck software, which is a digital download for $4 US.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: I like this mic
customer_reviews.text: I like this mic. I hooked it up to my Dell laptop to record an HR presentation at my work. The presenters were clearly recorded as well as most of what was spoken from audience members who asked questions during the presentation (a room of about 55 people). I had the mic on a waist high table at the front of the room close to the presenters but without them speaking directly into it. It's a good all-around mic for recording meetings, focus groups, presentations, etc. The mic is small so it doesn't take up much room in a backpack. I would purchase it again for our office if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Jim

customer_reviews.title: It is a small portable excellent microphone.
customer_reviews.text: It is a small portable excellent microphone. It is a condenser microphone and has to be treated as such. Be sure and adjust the distance from you to the microphone for the fullest audio. It makes a huge difference. With a laptop it is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Millar

customer_reviews.title: It is good one mic.
customer_reviews.text: I tried all modes but it takes all noises around in my environment even fridge humming. The 4 stars only because- I did expect something as the manufacturer says so. It works well. I think I need to go and try it onto outside filming. We will see..
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy G.

customer_reviews.title: Tiny Mic, Smaller price, High quality sound!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gaming mic. My built in Macbook mic just wasn't cutting it. Never happier with a purchase. Setup was simple, plug and play! Sound quality is really good on the noise cancellation setting. You do need to be relatively close to the mic, at least 3 feet for it to really pick you up well on this setting. But I just sat it on my desk behind my keyboard and I was good to go. People ask all the time in game what kind of mic I use, as they are usually impressed how good the sound quality is!
customer_reviews.author: Drew Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Get the Noise Reduction Software!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little microphone. I use it while recording on-screen tutorials. It is very sensitive and will pickup hums and hisses that you might not be aware of until you're listening to it later. I STRONGLY recommend the Noise Reduction software from Samson. It is $3.99 and is worth every penny. The difference is night and day.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Moeykens

customer_reviews.title: Gret little mighty mic
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good buy. The sound quality on this mic is really incredible for a consumer class product. It's actually worth having a couple of these if you are podcasting or recording. It works really well. Not saying it's a neuman or studio quality, but it sure gets the job done really well. Go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Georgi Offrell

customer_reviews.title: Great USB mic!
customer_reviews.text: Started recording a podcast and found these on Amazon. After doing some comparisons they seemed to be the right tool for the job. They sound great! They're pretty small. Just the mic isn't much bigger than a jump drive. They have a great recording sound, with 3 different options on a side switch so you can get a room sound, close mic sound or direction mic sound. For podcasting it works perfect. Not sure if it would work for much else than voice recording. But if that's what you need it for you can't really go wrong. Plugs in to USB and works right out of the box. For the price it's definitely a great product.
customer_reviews.author: hklfilms

customer_reviews.title: Good portable Mic
customer_reviews.text: I recently was working on voice over work for a couple basic videos. After the first video was completed with the mic in my computer I realized I needed some type of actual mic, but needed it to be small, portable and easy to use. This mic fits what I needed. It's not the best mic in the world, the price is great for what you get. It is quick plug and use. I have had no issues so far after making several videos and traveling with the mic.
customer_reviews.author: CoryP

customer_reviews.title: Don't Let The Size Fool You!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on expensive microphones. I bought this because I travel and needed something compact in the event a podcast opportunity arose. The quality is amazing and practical. This little mic packs a big punch! LOVE IT!!! BUY IT!!
customer_reviews.author: Honesty Currie

customer_reviews.title: Good as you get without a sound booth
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small, usb mic that I could use for video conferencing with clients and for recording a/v tutorials. This one has good pick-up, worked right out of the box, and (as long as I set it to uni-directional recording) is about as free of background noise as you get get without an actual sound booth. The base is nice and versatile for setting either on the desk in front of me or clipping to my laptop if I'm on the go, and it folds up compactly enough to fit into my (admittedly rather long) desk-caddy when not in use. I'm quite satisfied with the price I paid and the quality I got.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Ravenwood

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, very portable
customer_reviews.text: Great little thing but I wish the clamp opened wider so I could get it onto a regular monitor (not just a laptop monitor). Excellent sound quality and very portable. This would be perfect if it came with an angled mini-usb cable as the regular cable sticking out the side is a bit clunky.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Miller

customer_reviews.title: not the mic to sing like sinatra
customer_reviews.text: if you could sing like Sinatra, that is...but it works, and the sound quality is decent enough for speech or demo use. i used it on my song 'ShopCaesar' to test it...and it was good enough i posted it as a demo.
customer_reviews.author: cogbern

customer_reviews.title: Great little microphone
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for vlogging, and it works amazingly well. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Rlynne

customer_reviews.title: Good, but the picture seemed deceptive
customer_reviews.text: I got the product today. I connected to my laptop. On the picture, when browsing through the Amazon store, the product looks bigger on picture. It is connected via USB and its plug and play. The only down side of this product is that it lacks noise canceling ability. If you want to use it, you must ensure that environment is quiet else, it will be picking everything around.
customer_reviews.author: Pius Joseph

customer_reviews.title: For the price is the best upgrade for recordings and skype you will ever buy
customer_reviews.text: Incredible sound quality, portability and easy configuration. The mic do not need anything apart from the USB cable and is so small you can travel with it anywhere. The mic itself have a 3.5 mm input for headphones where you can listen to the audio of the PC + the mic input, so great for monitoring your record. Also, comparing to other mics (like my Razer Blade built-in mic) works great not having background noise signal (natural background and silent) and capturing the sound of your voice and surroundings. You will definitely hear the difference on your recording with this simple upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: tolarteh

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with Dragon naturally speaking version 12.5
customer_reviews.text: I got this mike for the specific purpose of using Dragon's voice dictation software to write emails and documents. I absolutely did not want to wear a headset all day long. I find that this little microphone does the job accurately and unobtrusively. What I like about it: 1) It attaches to any thing you want it to attach to using a clip. 2) It frees you from having to use a headset all day long. 3) Dragon performs as flawlessly as you could possibly imagine and when there are mistakes, it's just a function of the fact that no voice recognition software is completely accurate. In fact, I'm dictating this entire review using Dragon.
customer_reviews.author: PositiveLogic

customer_reviews.title: Buy It! Worth triple the cost!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Great price. Excellent sound. I bought this mic to increase the sound quality in my videos. I'm so happy I bought this one instead of spending $$$ on a more expensive "blue" one. Buy it. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: TXGarrett

customer_reviews.title: Not for non-studio environments!
customer_reviews.text: This mic may be good for podcasting in quiet environments, but it picks up far too much room noise and noise from the surface it is sitting on to be useful for VoIP calls in the real world. I purchased it because of the number of rave reviews but am very disappointed and returned it. A boom mic or headset mic is a much better choice for any but the quietest, studio-like environments. And yes, I did try both audio modes and the noise cancelling settings on my computer.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jasper

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I was previously recording with an internal mic, as well as a variety of inexpensive analog mics connected via the microphone port. I noticed a significant reduction in noise when using this mic instead. (capturing speech and sound effects for software) Setup was simple -- the mic worked fine on both of the Macs on which I've tried it so far. No driver install was required (Mavericks and Yosemite). The mic appears as an input source in Audacity as expected. I'm using the included zippered case for storage because it seems to protect the mic pretty well. Not having to buy a case was a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: JDC

customer_reviews.title: Scratchy sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to record lectures for online teaching. Sound quality is better just speaking in to my computer speakers. Background crackling so bad I had to throw out the hour-long lecture I recorded.
customer_reviews.author: Tania M. Maync

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: It would be fair to say that in the last year I've gone through 5 head sets, 2 microphones, and 1 ear piece. Priced from $30 - $210 ea. None have worked out. Each have their pro's and con's but I can count on ANY of them to work when I get a Skype call on my computer. The Samson Go Mic was inexpensive and works every time. Finally, I can receive and make calls w/out issue!!! PS... the microphone is freakishly sensitive. I wanted that but if you have a lot of background noise and you don't want it picked up... this will be an issue for you.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Good mic for laptop or beginning Youtuber.
customer_reviews.text: Been recording on this for a year or so off and on and can say it has a lot of good. With a proper mount this makes an alright mic for 1-2 people and the quality is up there. Sometimes it sounds a bit muddy and it needs a wind-guard if you plan on taking it outside. Didn't feel the need for a pop-filter as it seems not too pick up all that much p-popping. Got this for around $40 USD and for the money I was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: red

customer_reviews.title: small and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I don't know enough about recording to judge this, plus it's the first external mic I've purchased, but it absolutely does a better job than my lousy built-in mic. However, the booklet that comes with it says this includes a 10-foot cable, but it's only 4 feet. Not cool.
customer_reviews.author: opus88

customer_reviews.title: Great make - superb voice performance at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I use this mike with my Macbook when running a webinar. It's an amazing little device that works great. It picks up he voice clearly, even as the instructor moves around the classroom. The stand is very stable making it easy to position the mike any way I want.The Mac recognized it right away making step a snap. It's also very small, light, feels very sturdy and well built and came with a nice storage case as well. I leave it in my go bag so it's handy in case I need it unexpectedly. If you want a good mike at a reasonable price this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Just a user...

customer_reviews.title: Works but....
customer_reviews.text: Worked with my laptops, but the resulting sound lacks much "presence." Probably OK for use on a desk or around a table, but not great for large room (or church) recording. Internal noise seems to limit recording gain, but I cannot determine if this is due to the mic or the laptops.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Ogden

customer_reviews.title: The reviews were correct
customer_reviews.text: You probably read many reviews already about this wonderful microphone. It really is amazing for its small size. It is well built and sounds very good. Although, I would recommend using a pop filter since you have to get quite close to the mic get a nice bass filled voice. Highly recommended for podcast recording. Buy it and start recording that project already! Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Mafer Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t stay in position very well... but works good
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to give this 5 stars but the other reviews were correct, the mechanism for holding the mic in position is not the best, after a few hours it sags , otherwise I like the size and build quality for my small computer space
customer_reviews.author: Triskelion55

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mic for the price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to start recording software demos to post on YouTube, and was looking for a good entry-level recording mic. This thing is awesome. I use the -10db setting to eliminate ambient noise, and also purchased a pop filter (required) and a stand. The audio quality sounds so much better than recordings made with the built-in laptop mic. Definitely recommend, but you will need a pop filter for the -10db setting.
customer_reviews.author: Meganite

customer_reviews.title: Decent for recording class lectures, if you sit near the front of the class.
customer_reviews.text: I used this mic to record class lectures, when the mic on my cheap eBook laptop wasn't sufficient to hear the teacher. I had to fiddle a bit with the settings and positioning to get an okay recording. It did a passable job, recording the instructor from about the second row of the classroom. The instructor sounded a bit robotic, but understandable. My classmates weren't usually audible, because I had to use the uni-directional mode to hear the instructor without hearing every sniffle from the person sitting next to me. Any further back in the classroom, and there was too much ambient noise for the recording to be understandable.
customer_reviews.author: M Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Great Mic for Beginning Streaming
customer_reviews.text: I have been streaming for around 6 months now and this mic has provided all of the audio quality that I have needed up to this point. It has great sound detection and pick up for a smaller mic. If you are just starting your streaming career and looking for a cheap mic to get you going, then look no further! Obviously it won't be as tight on the surrounding sound as other more expensive mics, but 95% of the time you won't be able to tell the difference. Start here, upgrade later.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Money
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this thing is great. Works well picking up a room full of people. We used it for skype/google gaming sessions, as well as a short podcast, and while not amazing, is pretty dern good.
customer_reviews.author: braingamer47

customer_reviews.title: Marvelous value!
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised by the quality of this microphone! I have a very sensitive ear when it comes to feedback or unwanted ambience, this microphone works like a dream with Audacity. Excellent clarity and its very capable for professional use in my opinion. Grab one if you can, this does it all. Podcasts, livestreams or what have you, this microphone is worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product
customer_reviews.text: I recently needed to travel to Europe to do some interviews and bought this. The product is great for travel because it is small and easy to use and the sound is pretty impressive for such a little device. However, you'll want to do a little EQ on your project, for sure.
customer_reviews.author: titawu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound, small form factor, neat case
customer_reviews.text: Cute little microphone that picks up sound excellently. Perfect for virtual meetings and work calls. I use the cartioid mode with -10dB, no one's told me I'm too quiet yet. The travel case the mic comes with is really nice too, though I wish that the USB cable would fit in as well. With the fairly reasonable price, portable size and nice quality sound overall I'm pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Whimsical Windmill

customer_reviews.text: I am using it wirh my voice recognition software.i calibrated the mic and it preformed well.i will update in few wreks..

product_meta.title: Samson Go Mic Portable USB Condenser Microphone for Recording and Streaming on Computers (SAGOMIC)
product_meta.description: Size:untThe Samson GO MIC is a dual-pattern (cardioid and omnidirectional) studio microphone Featuring high quality onboard digital converters and USB interface fit into an extremely portable, fold-up design making it ideal for professional digital recording or podcasting. The built-in audio interface features a robust headphone output allowing you to monitor your voice with zero latency as well as the playback from your recordings. The unique clip design allows you to mount the microphone on your laptop or you can convert the clip mount to a convenient desk stand. The GO MIC is perfect for recording any acoustic audio source on your favorite software. Just plug in the supplied USB cable, launch your audio software and start recording. It is also great for VoIP and video chatting. The extended frequency and fast transient response ensures an accurate reproduction with linear characteristics from bottom to top. Whether you’re recording your latest song idea, A podcast, or your band’s next big hit, the GO MIC is the simplest and most comprehensive solution for high quality recording on a mac or PC.
feature_bullets: Portable USB microphone that delivers broadcast quality sound directly to your computer
Compact, fold-up design clips directly to your laptop monitor, sits on the desk, or can affixed to a microphone stand
Perfect for podcasting, live streaming, remote learning, working from home, voice-overs, video and Skype calls
Two selectable polar patterns: Cardioid pattern captures sound in front of the microphone while rejecting sound from the side and back. Omni pattern evenly picks up sound 360° around the microphone
Built-in 1/8" (3.5mm) stereo headphone output provides zero-latency monitoring from the microphone as well as a mix from the computer
Plug and play with Mac and Windows computers
